==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|人|t1=man|毛|t2=hair|匕|t3=cane|ls=ic}} – a man with long hair (an old man), leaning on a cane. Compare top component to {{och-l|孝}}.

Cognate to {{och-l|考}}; the most commonly cited example of {{zh-l|*轉注|reciprocal meaning}}.

===Etymology===
Unknown. Compare {{cog|sit-pro|*s-raw||withered, residue, corpse}}, {{m|sit-pro|*rwat||stiff, tough}}, whence {{cog|my|ရော်||wither, become overripe; age}}, {{m|my|ရွတ်||old, stiff, tough}}. See also {{zh-l|古}}, {{zh-l|故}}.

An old Sino-Vietnamese borrowing is {{m|vi|rệu||overripe, pulpy}}.

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[old]], [[aged]], [[elderly]] (for persons, animate and inanimate objects generally)
#* {{zh-x|人 老 了 記憶力 就 差 了。|One's memory worsens when age increases.}}
# {{†}} the [[elderly]], one's [[elder]]s
#* {{zh-x|老 吾 '''老'''，以及 人 之 '''老'''。|Respect my '''elders''', and then others' '''elders'''.|CL}}
# [[experienced]]
# {{†}} to [[respect]] (the elderly, one's elders)
#* {{zh-x|'''老''' 吾 老，以及 人 之 老。|'''Respect''' my elders, and then others' elders.|CL}}
# [[overcooked]], [[tough]], [[stringy]], [[hard]] (used in reference to cooked food or meat)
#* {{zh-x|牛排 太 老 了，我 咬 不 動 它。|The steak was so '''tough''' I couldn't eat it.}}
#* {{zh-x|這 雞蛋 煮 老 了，你 沒 掌握 好 火候。|This egg is '''hard'''; you didn't time it properly.}}
# [[stale]], not [[fresh]] (used in reference to food or potable liquids)
# [[always]], [[all the time]]
#* {{zh-x|你 別 老 這樣！|Stop being '''always''' like this!}}
# {{lb|zh|chiefly|dialectal}} [[very]], [[quite]]
#: → {{zh-l|很}}
#* {{zh-x|他 人 老 好 了。|He is '''such''' a nice person! [colloquial, somewhat regional]}}
#* {{zh-x|看到 儂 真個 老 開心。|I '''am''' really happy to see you.|tr=2khoe tau&3non&1tsen geq&3lau&1khe xin|SH}}
# {{lb|zh|affectionate|respectful}} {{non-gloss definition|Used before surnames to refer to heads or elder members of families.}}
#: → {{zh-l|小}} (''for younger people'')
#* {{zh-x|'''老''' ^張 馬上 来 了，我 得{děi} 趕緊 收拾 一 下 屋 子。|'''Old''' Zhang is going to be here any minute. I need to hurry up and straighten the room up a bit.}}
# {{lb|zh|usually|_|respectful|_|and|_|affectionate}} {{non-gloss definition|Used by analogy in several other relationship terms.}}
#* {{zh-x|老師|teacher}}
#* {{zh-x|老婆|wifey}}
#* {{zh-x|老公|hubby}}
# {{lb|zh|zoology}} {{non-gloss definition|Used before several animals considered noxious or unpleasant.}}
#* {{zh-x|老虎|tiger}}
#* {{zh-x|老鼠|mouse}}
# {{lb|zh|colloquial}} {{non-gloss definition|Used before placenames, particularly countries, to form nouns.}}
#* {{zh-x|老外|(pejorative) foreigner, [[furriner]], [[whitey]]}}
#* {{zh-x|老美|(pejorative) American person, [[Yank]]}}
#* {{zh-x|老毛子{zi}|(pejorative) Russian person}}
